intro: Achetaria ocymoides, commonly known as the small-leaved achetaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the wet season. Achetaria ocymoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
